reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.text: Wow, this is a great place to stay. It is surrounded by ponderosa forests frequented by deer and even has its own llamas!

We stayed in one of the suites which was luxurious, spacious, immaculate and beautifully furnished with a western theme. The bathroom was wonderful with a walk-in rainshower and jacuzzi bath. They have an outdoor pool with hot tub which was a lovely place to relax in the sun. The Lodge also provides an excellent complimentary breakfast in their charming breakfast room.
reviews.title: Always a pleasure
Absolutely Wonderful!
reviews.text: This place is very well run with excellent staff who really care - and it shows. Finally Sisters is a really gorgeous place to stop - we will definately stay here again if ever in the area.

reviews.title: Best Stay in Central Oregon
reviews.text: I have stayed here before and we always enjoy our time here and in Sisters. The rooms are very large and have a great view. The pool is nice but needed to be cleaned from pine needles. The hot tub is very large and wonderful. Breakfast included hard boiled eggs, Belgian waffles, and cereal. The hotel has a lot of land and is back in the pines with llamas right near the hotel. The mountains are close and the town is fun and friendly. My only downside to this visit was the Black Crater forest fire which was nearing town and making me a little nervous about possibly evacuating! But that was not the hotels fault. ....:) We did end up staying and still enjoyed our visit and are continuing on keeping updated on the fire and it's proximity to the town. I will definitely stay here again. It's the only place to stay in Sisters!!!

reviews.title: Delightful and excellent
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 days and loved it! They updated their rooms and we stayed in one of their new suites. Beautifully furnished, quiet, romantic and fairly priced. The staff is warm and friendly. Also, it was wonderful waking up each morning, having a nice cup of coffee on the patio and watching a four point buck and doe right in front of us meander through the beautiful grounds. Our stay was so memorable that we are going back this weekend to stay again for four more days! We would rather stay here at this place and drive the extra 25 minutes it takes to get to Bend. It is well worth it!

Hotel was recommended by hotel staff in Bend and we were very happy there. Good value. Met some other women that recommended a suite for next time. Would stay there 2 nights next time and have a full day to shop to fun stores. Good food at the brew pub for dinner and The Depot deli on the main street.
reviews.title: Very comfortable

reviews.text: We booked this hotel for a last-minute getaway before school started and were simply looking for a 'play to stay'. The hotel more than beat our expectations! Because we booked last-minute on a holiday weekend, we were only able to get a single king, which was not a problem, since our daughter is young and was perfectly happy with the pull-out couch.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: The room itself was spacious and updated. Each room has a large balcony that overlooks the grounds/swimming pool area. The bed was reasonably comfortable. The bath had updated flooring and plenty of counter space for everyone in the morning. The shower was nice, enough water pressure (hooray!) to rinse hair, etc.
reviews.title: Great access

reviews.text: The grounds were really beautiful and the hotel staff go out of their way to accomodate families. The pool is on the small side, but when we were there, it wasn't terribly warm, so that was not a problem. The hot tub is large and covered and I can visualize slipping into the tub in the winter months...with snow all around. The owners have several llamas that you can feed and many families enjoyed seeing the llamas each day. The last morning we were there, they had a woman doing a demonstration on spinning wool, which many kids seemed to enjoy. In addition, on the backside of the property, a large family of mule deer has taken up residence and it was so COOL to see the deer so close each morning.
reviews.title: Needs updating

reviews.text: The continental breakfast was a perfect start to the day; waffles, fruit, yogurt, bagels, toast, etc etc. Just about everything one could ask for.

reviews.title: Best hotel we stayed in on whole trip to Oregon
reviews.text: This was the best hotel that I stayed at in my whole trip to Oregon. Sisters is a must see town. The decor is beautifully done - western theme and the host and hostess are very friendly.
Very friendly and professional folks with excellent service.
reviews.title: Top Drawer All The Way and you get to feed the Llamas!

reviews.text: We had been treated very rudely and verbally abused across the street at the Comfort Inn by it's manager, and had packed up and left. We were going to stay just one more night in Sisters, and went to the Best Western Ponderosa and were just welcomed with open arms. Kathy at the front desk listened to my anguished account of what had just occurred across the the street and offered us an excellent room for it's value. It was so much appreciated that we stayed another two nights and enjoyed our trip after all!
reviews.title: Great visit!!

reviews.text: The Best Western Ponderosa is a great experience and the room we had was just perfect. Pine beams overhead with warm knotty pine woodwork throughout set the mood of the room. With a comfy sofa, and even a leather chair and ottoman to relax on while the fireplace warms you, it's easy to unwind in this fabulous setting before sleeping in a great King size bed with pine pole rustic headboard. Outdoor hot tub is a delight. They have Llamas you can feed, and there is a fitness trail to walk the wooded 10 acres there in quiet solitude.
reviews.title: Western town and hotel is great place to play and shop

reviews.text: Besides the great service, Kathy and Rob are truly geninually concerned that your stay there is fantastic.
reviews.title: Wow! I was delighted.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a long 2 story with 2 sections that stretch for a long ways. Their pool and hot tub are outside which were acceptable. Their grounds were in good condition, and were expansive. A large green grass area on both sides of the pool where your deck opens to. Beyond that is their llama coral with about 10 llamas. These animals seem to be well taken care of. On the other side of the llama coral is the highway, which is far enough away it doesn't intrude, although it shows you Sisters biggest problem traffic. Be warned it's bumper to bumper traffic thru this whole town frequently on the main road. The hotel itself was fine nothing special nor anything negative either. It was a typical older but in good shape B.W. non cookie cutter type with outside opening rooms which I like. In Sisters you don't have much choice, either here or the RV park and hotel. If you want more choices stay in Bend which is a half hour away. A cafe-resteraunt and supermarket are closeby, within walking distance in my opinion.
reviews.title: reasonable place in sisters
Rude, rude and rude ...
reviews.text: After driving for 14 hours to Sisters, we were greeted by a surly man at the hotel reception. Apparently he was the son of the owner or so he claimed and appeared to find some pleasure in informing us that the room which we had booked well in advance via Expedia was not available to us. He refused to offer an explanation or provide us with the telephone number of a more mature adult associated with the hotel. Instead he told us to get out and sleep in the car (all hotels in the Bend area were full over the July 4 holiday). When we asked him to re-check his records he grew angry and threatened to call the police. He was so rude that we felt sorry for him and everybody who stays at this institution.
